intro: Talinum nanum, commonly known as dwarf Malabar spinach, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features heart-shaped leaves that are edible and often used in local cuisines. It produces small, yellow flowers that develop into capsules containing numerous seeds. Talinum nanum is valued for its nutritional content and adaptability to various growing conditions.
